intro: Pastinaca vaginans, commonly known as the bladder root, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated leaf sheaths that resemble bladders. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is adapted to wet, marshy environments, which contribute to its unique botanical features.
